section.title: Phar file format
section.para:
All Phar files contain three to four sections:
a stub
a manifest describing the contents
the file contents
[optional] a signature for verifying Phar integrity

section.title: Phar file stub

A stub must contain as a minimum, the __HALT_COMPILER(); token at its conclusion. Typically, a stub will contain loader functionality like so:

There are no restrictions on the contents of a Phar stub, except for the requirement that it conclude with __HALT_COMPILER();. The closing PHP tag ?> may be included or omitted, but there can be no more than 1 space between the ; and the close tag ?> or the phar extension will be unable to process the Phar archive.

section.title: Phar Manifest Format
section.para: The Phar manifest is a highly optimized format that allows per-file specification of file compression, file permissions, and even user-defined meta-data such as user or group. All values greater than 1 byte are stored in little-endian byte order, with the exception of the API version, which for historical reasons is stored as 3 nibbles in big-endian order.
All unused flags are reserved for future use, and must not be used to store custom information. Use the per-file meta-data facility to store customized information about particular files.
The basic file format of a Phar archive manifest is as follows:

row.entry: Length of manifest in bytes (1 MB limit)
Number of files in the Phar
API version of the Phar manifest (currently 0.9.0)
Length of Phar metadata (0 for none)
Serialized Phar Meta-data, stored in serialize format
at least 24 * number of entries bytes

section.title: Global Phar bitmapped flags
section.para: Here are the bitmapped flags currently recognized by the Phar extension for the global Phar flat bitmap:

row.entry: If set, this Phar contains a verification signature
If set, this Phar contains at least 1 file that is compressed with zlib compression
If set, this Phar contains at least 1 file that is compressed with bzip compression

section.title: Phar manifest file entry definition
section.para: Each file in the manifest contains the following information:

row.entry: CRC32 checksum of un-compressed file contents
Serialized File Meta-data length (0 for none)
Serialized File Meta-data, stored in serialize format

section.para: The File-specific bitmap values recognized are:

row.entry: These bits are reserved for defining specific file permissions of a file. Permissions are used for fstat and can be used to recreate desired permissions upon extraction.
If set, this Phar contains at least 1 file that is compressed with zlib compression
If set, this Phar contains at least 1 file that is compressed with bzip compression

section.title: Phar Signature format
section.para: Phars containing a signature always have the signature

row.entry: The actual signature, 20 bytes for an SHA1 signature, 16 bytes for an MD5 signature.
Signature flags. 0x0001 is used to define an MD5 signature, and 0x0002 is used to define an SHA1 signature.
Magic "GBMB" used to define the presence of a signature.
